Description: This competency framework entails all competencies that were developed through a literature review and a focus group in the course of my master thesis.

Short name: Effects of Human Actions on the Environment
Description: Evaluate direct and indirect environmental impacts of human behaviour in order to recommend strategies that reduce impacts such as emissions, resource depletion, and waste.
Internalize importance of sustainable actions and foster intrinsic motivation to continue sustainable practices.

Short name: Effects of ICT Sector on the Environment
Description: Comprehend the effects of production, use, and disposal of hardware and software connected to the ICT sector.
Comprehend and identify pitfalls of sustainability, e.g. Greenwashing or Rebound Effect.
Propose and implement the expansion of an established system to ensure the integration of sustainability into existing company structures.
Capture and motivate an audience by communication with passion and poignancy and yet professionally in both oral and written form.
Understand the difficulties change brings for employees and meet them with compassion, patience, and resilience.
Comprehend and apply basic legal language and frameworks in order to reach a company's governance goals.
Inspect existing software in regards to their software quality on basis of relevant standards and sustainability aspects.
Comprehend the importance of inclusivity and accessibility of software and how to enhance them in new and existing projects.
Comprehend and convey the importance of a responsible approach to digital products and services in order to conceptualize and develop meaningful software products.
Understand the necessity to constantly check one's own work and change it if necessary in order to integrate sustainabiliy into work practices.
Connect academic resources in order to gather a holistic overview of a topic.
Inspect publications and other resources in regards to their quality and reliability.
Present complex and theoretical topics in a structured and captivating way.
Understand complex relations and structures in order connect different components of a overarching topic.
Place software products in a landscape and system and understand their connection and interferences.

Short name: No Single Source of Truth in Green Coding
Description: Comprehend the complexity of Green Coding as a topic and accept that for many issues there is no single source of truth but rather different approaches that need to be weighed up and compared.

Short name: Analysis of Dynamic and Evolving Fields
Description: Analyse dynamic and changing fields in order to stay on top of fastly evolving topics, e.g. energy prices.
Comprehend the environmental impact of choices in programming (e.g. algorithms, programming languages) and how their substitution could effect the environmental impact of a software.
Understand, inspect, and create data transfer networks in order to assess energy hotspots or diversions.
Understand components of internet in general and websites in specific.
Comprehend the core concepts, working methods, and areas of application of artificial intelligence systems in order to assess theiir environmental and social impacts.
Analyse existing systems and software regarding their design and architechtural choices in order to enhance them in regards to sustainability.
Include sustainability into requirements in planning phase of software engineering process.
Plan and execute projects in a structured, agile way in order to efficiently manage teams and roles.
Broaden horizon when conceptualizing new projects to not just include present day issues, but also past and future thinking.
Break down problems into tasks and distribute them fairly and according to individual competencies collaboratively in a team.
Break down problems into tasks individually, alot appropriate time, and ensure the meeting of deadlines.
Show openness, patience, and helpfulness in collaborative projects to ensure harmonic and productive work environment.
Inspect and assess the current situation in an organization or company accurately and holisticly in order to gain insights into possible impediments or improvements.
